data.title: 'Mezzocorona, vinci per noi!' - Crouchy's Big Euro Challenge Attempt!
data.text:
Crouchy's 'Mezzocorona, vinci per noi!' Big Euro Challenge Attempt! (Season Two at Comunale 2015/16)

Season Results Summary:

Results for first half of the season

Results for second half of the season

I was surprised at just how strongly we started the season. We went on a six game unbeaten run and looked at home at this level. Our little 1,000 capacity ground was getting filled for every home match and all looked well. However, when we met top sides like Pavia and Prato, things weren't quite so straight forward for us.

We reached the winter break in great shape, though, having had a comfortable start to the season. We weren't as solid at the back as I would have wanted us to be but we seemed able to find the back of the net with enough regularity to put points on the board.

The second half of the season certainly wasn't as comfortable. I always knew that if we had injuries, it could end up being really tough for us. So it proved, as we ended up losing the likes of Simone Loiodice, Manuel Gavilan and others. The replacements weren't good enough, we started to lose form and then we lost confidence. Five straight defeats took us through January to the middle of February and signified my worst spell as Mezzocorona boss. It was a seven game run without a win that took us into March. Very worrying times indeed.

As our best players returned, the confidence also came back, and back-to-back wins at home to Reggiana and away to Como got us back into the swing of things. It was still a bit hit and miss up until the end of the season though but at no point were we in danger of getting into a relegation battle. It was comfortable mid-table all the way. We ended the season with a 3-2 win at home to Sambonifacese. A good end to the season after a pretty terrible second half of the season.

Fire power wasn't enough to get us through that second half of the season and we proved to be far more fragile at the back than I expected. I need to improve the squad for next season to ensure that we don't take a step backwards.

Being positive, though, this was a solid season at Serie C1 level and we basically consolidated and didn't look out of place in this division. More of the same next season would be good and we'll aim for a slow but sure improvement, I hope.

Italian Cup:

We beat Serie C1/B side, Virtus Lanciano, in the first qualifying round. However, we were beaten in the second qualifying round by Serie B team Spezia.

Serie C Cup:

This was not a priority for us. We were knocked out in the 1st round away to Serie C1/B side Avellino.

IN:

| Date | Person | From | Fee | | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | 1.7.2015 | Alba, Fabio | Verona | Free | | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | 1.7.2015 | Tedesco, Giuseppe | Vicenza | Free | | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | 7.7.2015 | Eguelfi, Fabio | Free Transfer | Free | | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | 20.7.2015 | Bortoli, Marco | Free Transfer | Free | | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | 22.7.2015 | Gori, Leonardo | Free Transfer | Free | | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | 22.7.2015 | De Cello, Gabriel | Free Transfer | Free | | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | 23.7.2015 | Malcore, Giancarlo | Free Transfer | Free | | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | 27.7.2015 | Solini, Matteo | Free Transfer | Free | | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | 1.8.2015 | Corsi, Angelo | Free Transfer | Free | | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | 1.8.2015 | Evangelisti, Mattia| Free Transfer | Free | | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | | Total | | £0 | | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------|

All free transfers. Some very solid signings amongst this bunch of players.

Fabio Eguelfi turned out to be a very solid left-sided wide player. Giancarlo Malcore added some quality up front although he wasn't exactly prolific and had a pretty bad dry spell in the second half of the season. Matteo Solini was a quality signing in defence. The other players were good squad players, for the most part. I feel that I did good work in the market here to give us a really good chance of performing well at this higher level.

OUT:

| Date | Person | To | Fee | | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | 30.6.2015 | Princivalli, Nicola| Free Transfer | Free | | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | 30.6.2015 | Serafini, Mattia | Free Transfer | Free | | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | 30.11.2015 | Mazzoni, Elia | Free Transfer | Free | | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | 4.1.2016 | Miniati, Emanuele | Seregno | Free | | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | 6.1.2016 | Tedesco, Giuseppe | Lecco | £1K | | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | 7.1.2016 | Tait, Fabian | Lecco | £1K | | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | | Total | | £2K | | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------|

The first three players were free transferred at the end of their contracts as I didn't feel they would be useful at Serie C1 level.

The last three players were all sold in the January transfer window. The wage budget was an issue and I decided to try to sell a few fringe players to bring it under control. We probably could have got better fees here for one or two of these guys but I just needed a quick sale to get them off the wage bill.

Key players:

Simone Loiodice - Voted by the fans as their player of the year for the second year running. Was already at the club when I joined. Good solid attributes in the right areas at this level. Did very well as midfield playmaker.

Angelo Corsi - Solid wide midfielder who I signed on a free in pre-season. Very consistent performer.

Manuel Gavilan - Named as captain this season. Performed well but started making noises about wanting to leave.

Fabio Eguelfi - Solid wide player who performed consistently for us down the left flank.

Matteo Solini - Good attributes and did well for us. Prone to making the odd mistake but perhaps he will have matured this season. Hopefully we'll get more from him next season.

Tactical talk:

Once again, we played a no nonsense 4-4-2, rigid style, low creativity, basically making us well organised and hard to beat. Most matches, we approached with a cautious counter-attacking approach and for some matches we just aimed to defend deep and frustrate our opponents. We were pretty efficient, often not getting a lot of possession but defending well and taking our chances going forward. We ultimately did what was needed to put points on the board.

Bonus screenshots:

Our Best XI

Crouchy signs for another year with Mezzocorona. I wanted more but the board would only give me a contract for one more year.

The board review my season in charge. I think they were pretty happy.

New stadium! This is the big one! The board have announced plans for a new stadium, which is great as our tiny 1,000 capacity stadium just isn't cutting it at this level. This could make a big difference in the long run but in the short-term it means the purse strings are going to be tightened even more.

Next Season:

Thanks to the same bug as I experienced last season, I have to replace all of my staff as none of them would negotiate a new contract.

Next season is going to be really tough. The board have advised me that a wage budget cut is forthcoming and therefore I will have to make cuts to the squad even though I want to be able to improve the team so that I can continue to progress.

We are once again being predicted to finish in last place in the league. I'm going to have my work cut out in the summer to sort out this squad so that we can avoid relegation.

Some players will be leaving at the end of their contracts. At least one is a first team player who I want to keep but who I do not have the budget to offer a decent contract to.

I think we will have to bring in some loans and rely on younger players. I really hope I can keep the spine of the team together and then perhaps build a squad around it with loans and youth players.

I don't expect a lot of progress given the constraints we'll be under. Mid-table again would do nicely.

The new stadium will be coming next season so I hope that could make a big difference. Survival has to be the aim for next season and then maybe we can push on the season after with a new stadium and then some new 'revenue streams' as those financial types on the board of football clubs like to say!

Crouchy's 'Mezzocorona, vinci per noi!' Big Euro Challenge Attempt! (Season Three at Comunale 2016/17)

Season Results Summary:

Results for first half of the season

Results for second half of the season

On the whole, this season was very similar to the last one. The main difference was that we were able to be more consistent over both halves of the season. It was mostly the same squad, the same kind of tactics, the same lack of money and some very similar performances to last time around.

We reached the winter break in decent shape and managed a very solid second half of the season too, which saw us finishing in a comfortable mid-table position. We actually ended up with 4 more points than last season. We also lost less games and managed to finish with a positive goal difference. A small improvement but good enough for me considering that this was pretty much the same side as last year.

Off the pitch, we had the whole drama of being on the brink of administration and then finally entering administration in December. Players became unhappy and needed constant reassurances. On the pitch performances did suffer but I think I handled it quite well and we kept up a competitive push in mid-table. We never looked in too much trouble of going down but we certainly didn't look in any way as though we would trouble the sides going for the play-offs.

Just after the winter break, we lost our top scorer, Giancarlo Malcore, to a torn calf muscle which ruled him out for six months. This was a big loss but we still managed regularly to upset the odds. One absolutely huge player for us this season was Matteo Solini. His performances at the back were the key to us having the fourth best defensive record in the league.

This was a decent second season at Serie C1 level with a small amount of progress. I guess you could say that this was more consolidation. The new stadium is coming in the summer and this could improve the financial situation at the club and allow us to be more competitive. We can already say that we don't look out of place in this division, for sure, and if I can keep some of the squad together for next time around, we'll continue this very slow but sure feeling of progress.

Key players:

Matteo Solini - Voted by the fans as their player of the year. Put in so many good performances and was the key to our great defensive record.

Manuel Gavilan - Another good season from our captain. A very important player for us.

Giancarlo Malcore - Had a great first half of the season and just started to find his feet in front of goal when he picked up an injury that put him out for six months. I hope we'll see more of the same of him next season.

Simone Loiodice - Solid season if not quite as good as previous seasons. Unfortunately, I couldn't agree a new contract with him and so we have lost our best central midfielder.

Fabio Eguelfi - Another great season from the left-sided wide midfielder.

Tactical talk:

Same as previous years. Nothing has changed here.

We played a no nonsense 4-4-2, rigid style, low creativity, basically making us well organised and hard to beat. Most matches, we approached with a cautious counter-attacking approach and for some matches we just aimed to defend deep and frustrate our opponents. We were pretty efficient, often not getting a lot of possession but defending well and taking our chances going forward. We ultimately did what was needed to put points on the board.

Bonus screenshots:

Our Best XI

Crouchy signs for another year with Mezzocorona. I wanted more but the board would only give me a contract for one more year.

The board review my season in charge. This was a more lukewarm response than last time around.

Mezzocorona back on the road to financial recovery. We come out of administration and things look like they might be okay for a while. We're still losing money but the new stadium is coming soon and that may well help us in a big way.

Talking of the stadium, it has been delayed. This is a real pain. The sooner we get our much bigger capacity stadium, the sooner we can start selling more tickets and making more money on match days. Hurry up!

Huge losses recorded for Mezzocorona. The stadium is key to progress but it pretty much crippled us this season.

Next Season:

Thanks to the same bug as I experienced for the last two seasons ... blah blah blah ... I have to replace all of my staff as none of them would negotiate a new contract.

I've lost about seven players already due to contracts running out. At least one was a regular first team player, whilst most were squad players so it's not too terrible. It does mean that I have my work cut out in the transfer market trying to bring in some replacements who want to play for the tiny wages that we can offer here at Mezzocorona!

Next season may be a little less bumpy than this one. The board have given me an improved wage budget similar to that which I had when we first came into this league. I'm hopeful I can do some good with it.

I'm expecting to have to focus on young players so I'm not expecting anything too much in terms of progress next season. I think we'll look to consolidate some more.

Moving into the new stadium could really kick things into gear and put us into a better position for the year after.

So, I don't expect major progress given the constraints we've got at this club and mid-table safety would do quite nicely.
